title: Inscribed stele in the Sikel language
support:
A slab of limestone, narrower at the base, and rounded at the top; the bottom
                                        edge is roughly straight. The surface is roughly
                                        smoothed. There is minor damage to the face in the upper left quarter.

layout.p:
The text is arranged in a
                                        clockwise spiral, beginning at the lower left
                                        corner, and running right around the outer margin
                                        of the face, before proceeding up the left side
                                        for a second time.

provenanceFound._: Found in 1929 in the area of an ancient necropolis in contrada Sciri Sottano, 10km south-west of Licodia Eubea.

museum.name: Museo Archeologico Regionale Paolo Orsi
museum.description: An outstanding collection of archaeological material. The collection ranges from Siracusa and the surrounding territory (Megara Hyblaia, Akrai, Kasmenai etc) to encompass all of eastern Sicily, reaching as far as Gela and Agrigento. The ground floor covers prehistory through to the end of the Classical period. Upstairs includes Hellenistic and Roman Syracuse and a display of material from the catacombs. A gallery displaying material from Hellenistic eastern Sicily is in preparation.

nendas pu stebegpraareienborenaividepagostikeaitelube
Text after Agostiniani and Cordano 2002 Ribezzo 1933: nendas purenos tebeg pra arei en bourenai vide pagos-ti kealte inrube Pisani 1934(a): NENDAS[- c.7 -]TEBEIPRAAREIENBOURENAIVIDEPAGOSTIKEAITE.SI.IUBE Pisani 1934(b): Nendas [- c.4 -] tebei praareien Bourenai; vide-p agosti, keai te.si. iube Blumenthal: Nenda S[- c.6 -] tebei pra arei en bouren aivi de pago Ribezzo 1946-1947: nendas puren[a]s tebeg praarei en bourenai vide pagos-ti kealte inrube Pisani 1953[1959]: nendas [-c.4-] tebeipraareienbourenaividepagostikeaite[..]ss.iube Schmoll: ŒΩŒµŒΩŒ¥Œ±œÉœÄœÖœÅŒµŒΩŒøœÉœÑŒµŒ≤ŒµŒ≥œÄœÅŒ±Œ±œÅŒµŒπŒµŒΩŒ≤ŒøœÖœÅŒµŒΩŒ±ŒπœùŒπŒ¥ŒµœÄŒ±Œ≥ŒøœÑŒπ: Œ∫ŒµŒ±ŒªœÑŒµ.ŒπŒΩœÅœÖŒ≤Œµ Pisani 1964: nendaspurenostebeipraareienbourenaividepagostikeaite..ss.iube Manganaro: Nendas Purenos tebeg pra Arei en Bourenai Fide, pagos tike aite inrube Zamboni: ŒΩŒµŒΩŒ¥Œ±œÉœÄœÖœÅŒµŒΩŒøœÉœÑŒµŒ≤ŒµŒ≥œÄœÅŒ±Œ±œÅŒµŒπŒµŒΩŒ≤ŒøœÖœÅŒµŒΩŒ±ŒπœùŒπŒ¥ŒµœÄŒ±Œ≥ŒøœÑŒπŒ∫ŒµŒ±ŒªœÑŒµ.ŒπŒΩœÅœÖŒ≤Œµ Morandi: nendas purenos tebeg praarei en bo.renai vide pagostike aite.n..n.ube

The text is probably a funerary inscription. The letters do not run left-to-right, but in a spiral, beginning at the bottom left (a feature also found in some early Greek inscriptions). The initial word Nendas is found in other Sikel inscriptions and usually thought to be a personal name. According to ancient authors such as Thucydides, the Sikels were one of three ethnic groups present on the island before the arrival of the Phoenicians and Greeks. A small number of inscriptions from the sixth and fifth centuries BC have been found in the south-east of the island, including this one. These use the Greek alphabet (with the distinctive form of alpha êÖ¢ visible here) but appear to be in the Sikel language ‚Äì in other words, the practice of writing appears to have been adopted from the Greek settlers. The Sikel language is considered to be similar to the Sabellic languages of central Italy.
